message: I want to build a cli client for a web-based API and I'm looking for apps that serve as a good example and maybe some lobs that support a good, extensible "architecture" of the cli app

+1 for plac, you might be able to generate the CLI commands directly from some of your API code (assuming it's your API, that is)
+1 for plac FOR PYTHON 3.
For Python 2, http://www.doughellmann.com/projects/CommandLineApp/ has been very good to me.
There is also cement (http://pypi.python.org/pypi/cement), which is quite complete. It is a whole framework for creating CLI oriented apps.
The cmd module from the standard library provides support for line-oriented command interpreters. See http://docs.python.org/library/cmd.html and http://wiki.python.org/moin/CmdModule

wow - so many libraries. I always just use optparse  (I want to use argparse - but settling for the lower version requirement of optparse).
On best practices: Good error messages (please please!) e.g. is a file is missing - tell me which file you were trying to open.

I have written a program that uses cmd to provide the commands fronting an API, and optparse to parse input arguments. From http://wiki.python.org/moin/CmdModule : cmd is different than OptParse, in that OptParse is a tool for making command line tools. cmd, on the other hand, makes it so you can embed a command line within your program.
Plac looks not like an advanced arg parser. Or am I missing something?
